snippet: Voters in Georgia approved creating a commission to approve charter schools, while Washington State was still tallying votes on whether to allow charter schools.
abstract: Two ballot measures concerning charter schools, which are publicly financed but privately operated, spawn fierce battles in Georgia and Washington State; voters in Georgia approve creation of a commission to approve charter schools, while Washington State is still tallying votes on whether to allow charter schools.
lead_paragraph: Voters in Georgia approved creating a commission to approve charter schools, while Washington State was still tallying votes on whether to allow charter schools.

headline.seo: Georgia Approves Charter School Measure; Washington State Still Counting
headline.main: Charter Schools Win Support in Georgia Vote
headline.print_headline: Charter Schools Win Support In Georgia Vote
